name: MLH Hackathon Mentor Program
description: Ongoing mentor signup for MLH-affiliated hackathons worldwide. Fill out the form to be matched with hackathons near you. 200+ events per season.

name: MLH Coach Program
description: Paid position representing MLH at hackathon events. Must be 18+. MLH handles travel expenses and provides exclusive swag. Coaches support hackers of all skill levels.

name: Opportunity Hack - Hackathon Judge
description: Evaluate innovative technology solutions for nonprofits. Use your expertise to identify impactful projects and mentor development teams at global hackathons.

name: Technovation Girls - Virtual Judge
description: Score student tech entrepreneurship submissions online. Minimum 3 hours commitment (5+ submissions). No technical background required. Judging runs May through late June.

name: TechTogether Hackathon Volunteer
description: Volunteer as a judge (1-3 hours), mentor, or workshop host at TechTogether hackathons for underrepresented genders in tech. TypeForm signup, no commitment required.

name: Future Engineers STEM Judge
description: Register as a volunteer judge for K-12 STEM challenges including NASA TechRise. Pool of 4,700+ volunteer judges. Must be 18+ (no K-12 students).

name: CUNY Tech Prep Hackathon Volunteer
description: Judge hackathon projects or mentor fellows on project development at CUNY's summer hackathon. Also offers mock technical interview and workshop volunteer roles.

name: BU Spark! Mentor, Judge, or Speaker
description: Mentor student teams (7 sessions of 30-45 min each) or judge hackathon submissions using provided rubrics. Two annual hackathons: DS+X (October) and CivicHacks (February).

name: CivicHacks 2026
description: Civic tech hackathon at Boston University. Mentors needed Saturday, judges needed Sunday. Email buspark@bu.edu to express interest.

name: LA Hacks 2026
description: UCLA's flagship hackathon, 14th year. Dedicated Google Form signups for judges, mentors, and panelists. April 24-26 at Pauley Pavilion.

name: HackMIT 2026 Mentor/Judge
description: One of the largest collegiate hackathons with 1000+ participants. Mentors select shifts to help with technical problems. Check hackmit.org for 2026 judge/mentor application when available.
verificationNote: URL points to HackMIT homepage. Dedicated judge/mentor application page not yet available for 2026.

name: lablab.ai AI Hackathon Mentor
description: Apply to mentor at AI-themed hackathons. Always at least one active hackathon running. Centralized judging process. Requires name, email, expertise area, and LinkedIn.

name: MassChallenge Expert Judge
description: Join 500+ judges reviewing startup applications across three rounds. Register as an expert, select Judge checkbox, profile reviewed for match. Online and in-person judging.

name: Arch Grants Startup Competition Judge
description: Judge early-stage startup applications for equity-free grants. Industry experts, entrepreneurs, and university leaders evaluate applicants.

name: SIIA CODiE Awards Judge
description: Peer-recognized awards for tech excellence. Review 2-5 entries in Round 1 (3-5 hours total). Judge assignments emailed April 13. Must reapply each year.

name: We Connect The Dots Hackathon Judge
description: Judge student hackathon projects (ages 13-18) focused on UN Sustainable Development Goals. Virtual, one-time opportunity. Clear checklist provided.

name: ETHGlobal Cannes 2026
description: First of five 2026 in-person ETHGlobal hackathons. Judge applications not publicly listed -- typically recruited via invite/network. Contact via Discord.
verificationNote: ETHGlobal confirmed 2026 schedule but no public judge application page found. Judges are recruited by invitation.

name: ETHGlobal New York 2026
description: ETHGlobal NYC, June 12-14. Projects judged on creativity, functionality, technical difficulty, and impact. Judge recruitment via invitation/network.
verificationNote: Event confirmed on ETHGlobal 2026 calendar. No public judge application URL exists.

name: NASA Space Apps Challenge 2026
description: Annual global hackathon using NASA open data. Judges recruited per local chapter. Typically held in October. Check site for 2026 volunteer registration when available.
verificationNote: NASA Space Apps runs annually in October. 2026 volunteer registration not yet open as of February 2026.

name: Bitcamp 2026
description: 36-hour hackathon, 1,400+ students, largest on the East Coast. April 10-12. Volunteer, mentor, or host a workshop. Email hello@bit.camp for judge/mentor info.

name: HackIllinois 2026
description: UIUC premier hackathon, Feb 27 - Mar 1. Email contact@hackillinois.org to volunteer as a mentor or judge.

name: DevNetwork AI + ML Hackathon 2026
description: AI/ML focused hackathon co-located with AI DevSummit 2026. Challenge-driven format with sponsor judging rounds.
verificationNote: Devpost URL is a projected slug based on naming convention. Verify the page is live before applying.

name: Awesome Judging - Curated Opportunities List
description: Curated GitHub list of judging opportunities. Aggregator of links to hackathons, awards (CODiE, Stevie, Globee), and startup programs â€” not an opportunity itself.

name: Stevie Awards Judge
description: International awards recognizing professional excellence. Multiple annual award programs with category-specific timelines. Virtual judging.

name: Globee Innovation Awards Judge
description: Annual Innovation Awards honoring business excellence in technology, leadership, and customer service. Apply to join the judging panel via Globee's secure platform.

name: Tech in Motion Timmy Awards Judge
description: Annual awards recognizing top tech startups, managers, and employers in North America. Apply to serve on the judging panel.

name: Brandon Hall Group Excellence Awards Judge
description: Biannual awards for excellence in technology and education. Requires completing application, judging course, and interview.

name: NSF America's Seed Fund (SBIR) Reviewer
description: Review early-stage grant applications for small businesses and startups. Year-round applications accepted. Highly relevant for O-1A/EB-1 visa purposes.

name: Regeneron ISEF Judge
description: The world's largest pre-college STEM competition. Over 1,000 volunteer judges evaluate 1,700+ student research projects across 21 categories. Judges must hold a PhD, MD, or equivalent (6+ years research experience).

name: FIRST Robotics Competition Judge
description: Judge student robotics teams at FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC) events. Evaluate engineering design, innovation, teamwork, and outreach. Events run January through April across 100+ venues.

name: FIRST LEGO League Judge
description: Judge student teams (ages 9-16) on robot design, innovation project, and core values at FIRST LEGO League tournaments. No technical background required. Season runs October through April.

name: Science Olympiad Event Supervisor
description: Serve as an event supervisor (judge) at Science Olympiad invitationals, regionals, and state tournaments. Run and score individual events in your area of expertise. Thousands of volunteers needed nationwide.

name: Rice Business Plan Competition Judge
description: The world's richest and largest student startup competition. Over $5M in prizes. Judges are VCs, entrepreneurs, and corporate executives who evaluate student ventures across multiple rounds.

name: MIT $100K Entrepreneurship Competition Judge
description: One of the most prestigious university entrepreneurship competitions. Three phases: Pitch, Accelerate, and Launch. Judges are investors, founders, and industry leaders evaluating startup viability.

name: Hult Prize Judge
description: Judge social enterprise pitches at campus, regional, and global rounds. One of the world's largest student competitions with $1M+ in prizes. Backed by the United Nations and former President Clinton.

name: NIH Center for Scientific Review - Peer Reviewer
description: Review NIH grant applications as an external peer reviewer. CSR manages ~80% of NIH's extramural grant budget. Reviewers are PhD/MD researchers with active publication records. Highly relevant for O-1A/EB-1.

name: DOE Peer Review Panelist
description: Serve as a peer reviewer for DOE SBIR/STTR grant proposals. Evaluate scientific merit, technical approach, and commercialization potential. Experts in energy, physics, computing, and engineering needed.

name: Webby Awards Judge
organizer: International Academy of Digital Arts & Sciences
description: Join the International Academy of Digital Arts & Sciences (2,000+ members) to judge the Webby Awards, the leading international award honoring excellence on the internet. Members include web pioneers, executives, and creative leaders.

name: Edison Awards Judge
description: Judge innovations for the Edison Awards, named after Thomas Edison. 3,000+ judges from senior business leaders, academics, and former award winners. Evaluate innovations across science, technology, and social impact.

name: XPRIZE Competition Judge
description: Judge entries for XPRIZE competitions designed to solve grand challenges. Multi-million dollar prizes across climate, health, education, and space. Subject matter experts recruited per competition theme.

name: VEX Robotics Competition Judge
description: Judge student robotics teams at VEX Robotics Competition events. Evaluate engineering notebooks, design process, and teamwork. VEX is the world's largest robotics competition with events in 60+ countries.

name: Techstars Startup Weekend Judge
description: Judge 54-hour startup weekend events where teams go from idea to pitch. Judges are local entrepreneurs, investors, and business leaders. Over 150 events annually across 150+ countries.

name: ClimateLaunchpad Judge
description: The world's largest green business ideas competition. Judge cleantech startup pitches at national and international finals. Operates in 60+ countries with 200+ partner organizations.

name: Regeneron Science Talent Search Judge
description: The nation's most prestigious pre-college science competition, often called the 'Junior Nobel Prize.' Judges are distinguished scientists who evaluate 40 finalists' original research. Alumni include 13 Nobel laureates.

name: CIO 100 Awards Judge
description: Judge enterprise technology innovation for the CIO 100 Awards, honoring organizations that exemplify the highest level of operational and strategic excellence in IT. Panel of industry experts evaluates submissions.

name: SBA Growth Accelerator Fund Judge
description: Review SBIR/STTR proposals across federal agencies (SBA, DOD, HHS, NASA, etc.). Expert reviewers evaluate technical merit, commercial potential, and team qualifications. Compensated review opportunity.
